results.title: After 7 Years of Failing to Fix Afghanistan, Ghani Makes a Hasty Escape
results.abstract: By the time ex-president Ashraf Ghani fled the country, the hot-tempered leader was isolated and ineffective. Critics blamed him for the chaos in Kabul, saying he had betrayed his people.
results.byline: By Matthew Rosenberg and Adam Nossiter

multimedia.caption: A poster of Ashraf Ghani outside the deserted domestic terminal at the airport in Kabul on Sunday morning.

results.abstract: Scrambling to evacuate Afghanistan.

results.title: What Scenes From the Taliban’s Victory in Afghanistan Reveal
results.abstract: The fall of Afghanistan’s government was captured in hundreds of videos from across the country. We analyzed some of the key moments.
results.byline: By Haley Willis, Christiaan Triebert, Evan Hill, Brenna Smith and Dmitriy Khavin
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

results.title: Chaos and Desperation at the Kabul Airport
results.abstract: Maps and satellite images of the airport show the chaos as people race to leave Afghanistan.
results.byline: By Lazaro Gamio, Karen Yourish, Lauren Leatherby and Sarah Kerr
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces
